main event: A civilian reported a sighting of a single unidentified object over Columbus, Ohio, on August 17-20, 1965.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for about 4 hours between midnight and 4 A.M.,The object was described as small, about the size of a star but appeared stationary and sometimes rushed away,The object exhibited bright-dim shifting colors and moved contrary to known star or planet motion,The witness estimated the object was about 150 feet away,The report was submitted to the Air Force, but the witness did not attempt to investigate further.
witness description: a civilian, John Boyd, age 11, male
